author: Staff Reporter
text:
Chief Minister N. Rangasamy, on Monday, announced that the government will recruit around 200 Coastal Security Home Guards shortly.

Inaugurating the coastal police station and jetty here, he said that fishermen and youth residing along the city’s coastline will be given priority in recruitment of Coastal Security Home Guards.

The Coastal Security Home Guards will be a separate cadre within the Police Department. The government had proposed creation of a separate wing for augmenting the coastal security and the notification will be released soon, he said.

Mr. Rangasamy said the government was committed to implement welfare measures to police personnel including timely promotion. The government would implement all genuine demands of the department in due course, he said.

The coastal police station has been constructed at a cost of Rs 37.27 lakh at Thengaithittu fishing harbour. A jetty for berthing the boats of the Coastal police has also been constructed at Rs.44.24 lakh. Speaker V. Sabapathy, Inspector General of Police Praveer Ranjan were present.
title: UT to recruit 200 Coastal Security Home Guards
